item.title: How to Get & Use the HMG Emplacement in Helldivers 2
item.description:
With a Personal Order to kill 75 enemies using the HMG Emplacement , players in Helldivers 2 might struggle to figure out where they can get their hands on the HMG Emplacement, or they might not know what mission will make this the easiest to complete. Luckily, we know the answers you seek.

If you're struggling to get and use the HMG Emplacement, then check out our useful guide below. We'll tell you how to get the HMG Emplacement, and what missions you should be using it in, so you can easily complete your Personal Order and net yourself 15 Warbond Medals.

How to Get the HMG Emplacement in Helldivers 2

The HMG Emplacement is a Stratagem that can be purchased for 10,000 Requisition Slips once players reach Level 10 . Once both requirements have been met, head to the Ship Management and purchase the HMG Emplacement under the Bridge section of Stratagems.

Once acquired, the E/MG-101 HMG Emplacement can be found in your Loadout under the Defensive Stratagems, called in with the Stratagem Code: Down, Up, Left, Right, Right, Left . There are unlimited uses for the HMG Emplacement, with a 4.75-second call-in time and a cooldown of 154 seconds before you can call in another.

How to Use the HMG Emplacement in Helldivers 2

The HMG Emplacement is a turret that needs to be manually mounted and controlled by the player . While slow to turn, the HMG Emplacement has Heavy Armor Penetrating rounds that make it great at killing most targets. However, it should be used to focus on crowd control and lightly armored targets, as the ammunition is limited to 300 rounds.

Subscribe to our newsletter for Helldivers 2 HMG tips

Want more Helldivers 2 guidance? Subscribe to our newsletter for clear HMG Emplacement strategies, loadout recommendations, and mission choices to finish Personal Orders and master heavy turrets across missions and encounters.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

The HMG Emplacement works best against Terminid swarms due to their dense numbers and squishy armor that is easily penetrated by the turret. If you have a Personal Order to use the HMG Emplacement, we recommend the Eradicate Terminid Swarm mission , which is a small area in which you fight endless waves of Terminids.

9 /10

Helldivers 2

Follow
Followed
Third-Person Shooter
Extraction Shooter
Action
Science Fiction
Systems

Top Critic Avg: 83 /100 Critics Rec: 91%

February 8, 2024

Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, In-Game Purchases, Users Interact

item.title: Skyrim: Best Follower Mods You Need To Install
item.description:
Few things revitalize a playthrough of Skyrim more than a memorable companion. Loyal friends, witty foils, snarky chums - follower mods have grown so sophisticated that they outshine the vanilla cast. With fully voiced dialogue, expansive questlines, and custom AI, today’s mods turn followers into some of the most compelling characters in Tamriel.

Nevertheless, the volume of options can still overwhelm the most seasoned Dragonborn. Below are some of the best follower mods every player should try at least once, focusing specifically on originality, polish, voice work, and how seamlessly each companion fits into Skyrim ’s world.

Updated on February 4, 2026, by Mark Sammut: Followers are one of Skyrim's highlights, and the Special Edition version comes with a pretty huge selection of companions. You can easily just stick to the in-game ones and not worry about anything else; however, you will be missing out on one of Skyrim's best aspects: Mods. Yeah, it really shouldn't come as a surprise that the community has put together a lot of great companion mods.

For this update, we have added a short section recommending some Follower mods that complement the custom companions.

The mods are for Skyrim Special Edition .

Who’s That Character?

Identify the silhouettes before time runs out.

5.0 s
0 / 10

Results

0

High Score: 0

—

More Games
Who’s That Character? Identify the silhouettes before time runs out.
Easy (7.5s)Medium (5.0s)Hard (2.5s)Permadeath (2.5s)
5.0 s
0 / 10
Results
0
High Score: 0 —
More Games

General Follower Mods That You Should Consider Installing

While this article will mainly focus on custom characters, let's first include a short section with a few general Follower mods that could be useful to have. These aren't necessarily game-changing, but they make the process of existing in Skyrim slightly more enjoyable.

Nether's Follower Framework Or Followers Can Loot

  • Mod Link (NFF) or Mod Link (Followers Can Loot)
  • Created by : Netherworks (NFF) or powerofthree (FCL)

I'm listing these two mods as they are both useful and can serve a similar function, but I would recommend Nether's Follower Framework if somebody is looking for a comprehensive but resource-friendly download that improves Skyrim 's companions. NFF allows you to have 10 companions at one time, along with a lot of QOL adjustments and general features.

Followers Can Loot is a pretty old mod by this point, but it can still be useful by adding an option to have companies loot bodies. Just talk to them, and you will get a bunch of dialogue options to determine what type of loot they will loot. This works with all default followers that are in the base version of Skyrim Special Edition , along with supporting unlimited follower mods that allow players to be accompanied by as many companions as they want. NFF covers this ground, so no need to install FCL if you have the former.

Companions Refine Mod (Sofia — Inigo — and More)

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : DylanJames

We will discuss companions like Sofia and Inigo later down the line, but this mod deserves a quick mention since it alters the design of a few of the most famous custom Followers created by the modding scene. As suggested by the title, this mod gives a few characters a visual makeover and tweaks their file paths/race so they are a better fit for the vanilla game's actors. While you should try out each companion's default mod first, this one could be worth checking out if a Follower's appearance isn't clicking with you.

BJORN

A True Nordic Companion

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : danghidini

If players ever felt the vanilla Housecarls were just placeholders for actual Nord muscle with personalities, Bjorn is your man. This bearded tank is designed from the ground up to complement two-handed melee builds. Bjorn uses his own voice pack that’s lore-appropriate, his idle banter being smartly limited, and he avoids the repetitive chatter that plagues lesser mods.

He comes with a significant quest chain, and if players follow it through, they’ll be rewarded with a friend (or lover) for life. Overall, Bjorn has enough personality, courtesy of his over 4,200 voice lines, to keep him relevant well past the opening hours.

Malryn

The Breton Spellsword

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : Silver

Malryn will greet players with a smile and a fireball between her fingers when players spot her in the Winking Skeever in Solitude. This Breton from Rivenspire brings over 3,000 lines of dialogue to the table, along with her blend of magical and martial abilities. She’s an eager adventurer who's genuinely excited to explore Skyrim alongside the Dragonborn and possesses a “regard system” that evolves the relationship between herself and the player.

Malryn’s combat style focuses on conjuration magic, making her particularly effective for players who want some magical support in their corner. For added immersion, she's compatible with camping mods, which is ideal for players who choose not to rely on fast travel. With thoughtful commentary on various quests, Malryn makes the vanilla experience better without overwhelming players with inane chatter.

Aniya

Sorceress Supreme

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : Kenerad and Peachyninja

Magic companions can be glass cannons, but Aniya flings her spells with precision. She features several thousand lines of voiced dialogue, recorded in a way that makes her feel as if she’s been in Skyrim since day one. Players can find Aniya at The Bannered Mare in Whiterun, where her intro quest gets the ball rolling on her backstory.

The mod features a romance system complete with relationship ranks, custom dates, and marriage options for those seeking a long-term commitment. Her dialogue is faction-aware and includes outfit management options, allowing players to customize her appearance. She also has a "relax mode" for downtime moments. While her magical abilities make her ideal for mage builds, her well-developed personality and voice work ensure she remains engaging for any playstyle.

Vayne Remastered

The Dhampir Assassin

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : coldsun1187 and Jobi-Wan

Vayne is a character who straddles the line between mortal and undead, being a hybrid of Dunmer and Nord vampire bloodlines. Voiced by Alexia Renaldis with over 580 lines of dialogue, Vayne's story revolves around betrayal and transformation from an illusion mage into an assassin. Created by coldsun1187 and Jobi-Wan, this remastered version refines the original concept into a more polished experience.

Players can recruit Vayne at Mistveil Keep in Riften, where her ties to the city's underworld become apparent. Her combat specialization lies in stealth enhanced by illusion magic. Vayne comes equipped with unique perks like "Blood Money" and "Nightmare" that reflect her vampiric heritage. The mod also features a romance system for those interested in going down that route. Her background connects naturally to the Dark Brotherhood and Thieves Guild questlines, making her an ideal companion for the morally flexible Dragonborn.

Xelzaz

The Telvanni Argonian

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : BluePwnsU

Players can always use a few more Argonian followers in Skyrim . They're one of the most interesting races in The Elder Scrolls lore, so installing a few mods that add several more of these reptilian rogues is worth it. Fortunately, fans don't have to look far when it comes to excellent Argonian follower mods.

Xelzaz is yet another fully-voiced follower, complete with over 8,500 lines of dialogue. In addition to his own unique questline, Xelzaz will also comment on various goings-on in the game. He can cook meals, brew potions, and read books aloud to the player while traversing the map. This intrepid Argonian even has a personalized theme and combat music. Best of all, he will also interact with other follower mods on this list, including Nebarra, Remiel, and Lucifer.

Shirley

Skyrim's Grandma

  • Mod Link
  • Created/Uploaded by : The Circantolius Team / Thesparalius

It's fair to assume that many Skyrim players have probably heard of Shirley Curry. She's an 89-year-old YouTuber whose content revolves around Skyrim playthroughs. The Elder Scrolls community has bestowed upon her the affectionate nickname "the Skyrim Grandma."

Now, through the efforts of the modding community, Shirley herself can be recruited as a follower in Skyrim . She even recorded lines of dialogue specifically for the mod, which is a nice touch. When looking to explore with a more lighthearted companion, Shirley is a safe bet.

Lucifer

The Cagey Argonian

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : MrVideoFreak

Although Xelzaz will keep players busy for a while, fans who want another Argonian to tag along on their adventures should consider adding the intimidatingly-named Lucifer as well. This intriguing companion has over 6,000 lines of dialogue and will gradually open up about his past as players gain his trust.

GR Report: Subscribe and never miss what matters

Level up your gaming knowledge with Game Rant, packed with news, reviews, and insights from the gaming world.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Lucifer is a competent warrior and archer who will stick by the player's side through thick and thin. Even though he may disagree with the Dragonborn's actions from time to time, Lucifer is a companion worth learning more about.

Sofia

The Free Spirit

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : John Jarvis and Christine Slagman

Sofia is one of the most highly endorsed follower mods on Nexus. Her popularity stems mainly from her humorous (and often lewd) lines of custom dialogue. Traveling with her tends to brighten Skyrim 's dreary atmosphere considerably.

The voice acting for Sofia is also top-notch. Listening to her jokes and comments doesn't get old easily, and breaks up the humdrum routines of exploration. Players looking for another lighthearted companion should certainly consider Sofia on their next playthrough.

Gore

A Versatile Companion

  • Mod Link
  • Created by : goredev

Gore is a standalone follower with hundreds of lines of fully voiced custom dialogue, a detailed storyline with multiple lengthy quests, and custom commands unique to the character. Players can even direct Gore to set up camp, hunt, and cook, with the details changing depending on the region. This is a self-contained feature that doesn’t conflict with dedicated survival mods like Campfire and Simple Hunting Overhaul.

The campsites Gore sets up change and evolve as his quests progress and the story unfolds. It’s an immersive way to introduce a sense of bonding between the player and Gore. Best of all is a rechargeable flask players can get from Gore that heals 50% of the player's HP and comes with 5 charges, sort of like Skyrim’s version of the Estus Flask. It can be recharged at Gore’s camps once the charges run out.

item.title: 10 Best FPS Games Set In The Past
item.description:
Most first-person shooters take place in the present (at the time of release) or in the future with some high-concept twist. For example, the Halo series is one of the best sci-fi shooters around, while Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare takes place in the 2000s. Then there are games like Fallout that have a retro aesthetic, but technically take place in the future.

For anyone who likes looking to the past, there are some great historical and fantasy-based first-person shooters out there. They may bend the definition of "shooters set in the past," but either way, there’s some good variety with the following gamees for those tired of the same old, same old modern-day shooter formula.

Call Of Duty: Black Ops

Beware The Numbers

Call of Duty: Black Ops
8 /10
Released
November 9, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Treyarch
Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

There are a lot of great Call of Duty games tackling the past, but among the pile, Call of Duty: Black Ops’ campaign is still a top-tier pick. The game largely follows Alex Mason throughout his recollection of events involving a CIA operation in Cuba that largely spirals out of control.

While the point of many missions is to go in quietly, this is not a stealth game by any means. With tight controls, players will play through one bombastic set piece after another, all in the name of keeping the peace for America. By the end, players will be wondering about the nature of the “Numbers” as well.

Medal Of Honor: Frontline

Storming The Beaches

Medal of Honor: Frontline
FPS
Systems
Released
May 28, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t // Violence
Developer(s)
EA
Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

There are a lot of interpretative twists on storming the beaches of Normandy during World War 2 in movies, but Medal of Honor: Frontline was one of the first to do it this well in a video game. While not the most technically impressive game nowadays, the chaotic energy players can get riding up to the beach with their brothers in arms to fight the Nazis is riveting, along with the rest of the missions.

The shooting is pretty decent for a 2000s-era game, although it’s no Halo: Combat Evolved . The most impressive thing about it to this day is the audio design because, with a good sound system or headphones, players will feel like they are in the heat of the war in Europe. This is where Medal of Honor peaked.

Battlefield 1

Shovel Soldier

Battlefield 1
9 /10
Released
October 21, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
DICE
Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

Not many World War 1 games exist because it’s a tricky war to frame an entire game around. Kudos go to the Battlefield 1 team for making it happen in a compelling manner. Instead of focusing on trench warfare, the game showcases a lot of efforts during “The Great War”, from driving tanks in the aforementioned trenches to flying planes and taking down zeppelins to riding horses through battlefields.

The shooting mechanics are smooth, but the real treat is bashing enemies with shovels in close-quarters combat because that’s a novelty that not many games allow (beyond Shovel Knight ). It has a strong campaign and solid multiplayer community that is still active today.

Wolfenstein: The New Order

Not On My Watch

Wolfenstein: The New Order
8 /10
Released
May 20, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
MachineGames
Genre(s)
FPS, Stealth, Action, Adventure
Powered by

Wolfenstein: The New Order starts as a World War 2 shooter, with franchise hero B.J. Blazkowicz storming a Nazi stronghold to save the day. Unfortunately for everyone in this game, the Allies do not win the war. Instead, the globe bends the knee to the Nazi empire.

This alternate history game reimagines the world if it were ruled by Nazis, and it’s haunting. Thankfully, B.J. isn’t done with them yet, and neither are his resistance buddies. It’s an absurdly bloody game with surprises and comedic bits strewn throughout. It manages to be both a throwback and a modern shooter. It’s a shame more games don’t try to be as bold as Wolfenstein: The New Order .

BioShock

Somewhere Beyond The Sea

BioShock
Released
August 21, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Irrational Games
Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

BioShock takes place in the 1960s, although it’s hard to tell given that players dive into an undersea utopia for the entire campaign. Inside this fallen paradise, Rapture, players will have to battle the inhabitants to escape and, thankfully, they will be armed to the teeth with pistols, Tommy guns, and mystical powers transplanted through potions called Plasmids.

Plasmids, and the lumbering Big Daddy enemies, are what BioShock is best known for, along with the absolutely haunting locale of Rapture. It’s a great shooter on top of being one of the most atmospheric horror games of all time.

Resistance 2

The Fall Of The America

Resistance 2
FPS
Systems
Released
November 4, 2008
ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language

Developer(s)
Insomniac Games
Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

Like Wolfenstein: The New Order , the first Resistance game took place during World War 2, but instead of Nazis, the world combined their strength to stop an invasion by a species called the Chimera. Unfortunately for humanity, the Chimera won, stretching their campaign from Europe to the West Coast of the U.S.

In Resistance 2, set during the 1950s, the first game’s protagonist, Nathan, returns to stop what little Chimera he can. Armed with alien weaponry, like bullets that can track targets, players will use plenty of guns to even the odds. Traveling across a battered USA and fighting towering mechs, hordes, and aliens alike helps Resistance 2 stand out among other alien invasion games.

TimeSplitters 2

Through The Eras

TimeSplitters 2
Released
October 8, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Free Radical Design
Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

TimeSplitters 2 begins in the future, but every mission sends the heroes back in time to a specific era. For example, the first mission is stealth-based and takes place in a Siberian base in 1990. Other time periods include checking out Notre Dame in 1896 or Chicago in 1932, and each mission is different than the last.

Among the trilogy, TimeSplitters 2 stands out as the most inventive game in terms of its weapons, gadgets, locations, and genuine surprises in the story. The nice thing is that all the TimeSplitter games are available on a variety of modern platforms.

Call Of Juarez: Gunslinger

An Evolving Western

Call of Juarez: Gunslinger
8 /10
Released
May 22, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Techland
Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

Call of Juarez: Gunslinger is a Western shooter with as much rifle and revolver action that any John Wayne fan can handle. The best thing about the game is its story. It revolves around Silas, a bounty hunter who is recounting his past work in a bar.

As Silas tells his story, players play through what he describes. Other bar patrons will chime in with corrections that don’t seem to fit the legends they heard. When this happens, the level will change in various ways to match. Sometimes it will be topographical, and other times it will switch up the enemies. Either way, the gunslinging action and the storytelling make it a must-play.

Darkwatch

Vampires And Cowboys

Darkwatch
Released
August 16, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PlayStation 2, Xbox (Original)
Powered by

Darkwatch is another Western, but it has a paranormal twist involving vampires. Players are a freshly turned vampire, Jericho, aided by the titular Darkwatch, and trying to stop the vampire disease from spreading. Beyond vampires, players will be shooting down plenty of skeletal warriors and other demons with inventive supernatural-themed revolvers, crossbows, and more.

Subscribe to our newsletter for historic shooter picks & insights

Hungry for more curated takes on retro, historical, and fantasy shooters? Subscribe to our newsletter to explore deeper recommendations, context, and thoughtful retrospectives across these gaming genres and similar titles.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Jericho can also gain some powers, and depending on good or bad decisions, his skill tree will vary. It’s not the deepest shooter as the campaign is brief, but the setting is top-notch, and there’s simply no other FPS like it.

Singularity

An Experiment Gone Wrong

Singularity
8 /10
Released
June 29, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Raven Software
Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

Singularity is a highly underrated shooter from 2010 involving an incident going haywire within Russia, causing a singularity event. Players are sent in as a marine investigator, Captain Renko. When he enters the test facility, he travels back to 1955, before the incident happens.

With a time device he acquires, players can alter the environment as they see fit. For example, they can restore a rusty staircase in the present to make it look like it did in the past to get by. This time device can also be used in combat to slow enemies down, as one example. Singularity can be likened to the atmospheric horror of BioShock , but on dry land.

item.title: 2026 Video Game Release Date Calendar
item.description:
Video game releases were hot and heavy in 2025, and while we still don't know much about the games coming out in 2026, we can expect even more juggernauts to release.

This 2026 video game release date calendar will stay updated over the year as new video games are revealed, whether through Summer Game Fest, The Game Awards, a Nintendo Direct, State of Play, or whatever else.

We're only adding games to this list that have confirmed release windows for 2026. For games that are vaporware at this point, like Beyond Good and Evil 2 , for example, will not be on the list until Ubisoft confirms a date or at least an expected release year.

Updated on February 4, 2026:

---

Caves of Qud comes to Switch on February 16.

Overwatch 2 is coming to Switch 2 this Spring.

Check out our Interactive 2026 Release Date Calendar here!

item.title: New Cozy Game on Steam Is the Perfect Hybrid of Stardew Valley and Animal Crossing
item.description:
An upcoming farming simulation on Steam, Everbloom , carries strong Animal Crossing and Stardew Valley vibes while carving out its own identity. Many Steam users have seen indie farming sims trying to mimic the genre's top hits, but Everbloom doesn't feel like a copycat.

Developer Torbie is releasing Everbloom as its first game on Valve's storefront. The studio has spent nearly three years developing it and has been sharing behind-the-scenes glimpses with fans throughout that time. The team emphasizes that Everbloom 's world is handcrafted, making it clear that no AI shortcuts were used in its creation.

Everbloom Features at a Glance

  • CRAFT a wide range of objects
  • FARM different crops
  • BREED animals
  • EXPLORE dungeons
  • INVITE up to three players to join you (4-player co-op)
  • DATE villagers
  • FISH and cook
  • CUSTOMIZE the farm
  • UNLOCK new pieces of furniture and decorations

Animal Crossing Vibes Are Undeniable in Everbloom

It won't take long for fans of games like Animal Crossing to be charmed by Everbloom 's anthropomorphic animals. Players can choose from various animal types and customize them to create their ideal character. The game's cutesy visuals also bring to mind Animal Crossing and even Dinkum .

Trailers show a town near the player's farm where they can socialize and meet other anthropomorphic NPCs. Interestingly, despite being animal characters themselves, players can still own and breed livestock like cows and pigs. Even better, Everbloom 's livestock are said to have distinct personalities that can be passed down from parents to offspring. While the details of this mechanic are still unclear, cozy farming sim fans will likely be eager to explore it.

Everbloom Gameplay Takes the Best of Stardew Valley

While Everbloom 's visuals lean toward Animal Crossing and Dinkum , its core gameplay is closer to Stardew Valley . Crafting, farming, foraging, and light dungeon-crawling drive progression. Players will try to expand their farm, care for livestock, and engage in side activities like fishing and cooking. Dating is another Stardew -like feature, allowing players to woo different NPCs, though some characters may reject advances. As with Stardew Valley , successful dates in Everbloom unlock new lore and reveal hidden secrets unique to each character.

Everbloom also includes a cave system beneath the city, which players can explore through puzzle-solving and mining. Unlike Stardew Valley 's dungeons, these caves have no combat. Players primarily work to unlock new sections of the caves, uncovering more of the game's lore as they progress.

When Whimsical Meets Absurd

One of Everbloom 's most charming features is its quirky sense of humor, which even influences the gameplay. For example, players can grow buckets of popcorn as crops or produce chocolate milk by feeding cows candy bars. And these playful twists are sure to help it stand out. With the genre becoming somewhat oversaturated, fans are likely to welcome every bit of creativity and imagination the game offers.

Why Farming Sim Fans Should Keep an Eye on Everbloom

Developer Torbie's cozy sim has been accepted into Epic Games' "Epic MegaGrants," a grant program for indie games with strong potential. This recognition suggests the game has caught the attention of investors and likely received funding from Epic Games.

Subscribe to our newsletter for in-depth Everbloom coverage

Explore Everbloom and the cozy-farming scene by subscribing to our newsletter for in-depth analysis, developer insights, hands-on impressions, and thoughtful comparisons that show how Everbloom measures up to Animal Crossing, Stardew Valley, and other ind
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Being part of the program is promising for fans, as it indicates early confidence in the project. Securing Epic's backing means the developers have presented a convincing proof of concept and appear capable of delivering a solid game.

More Games

Everbloom doesn't have a confirmed release date yet, so players should wishlist it on Steam to receive a notification when it launches. Meanwhile, fans eager for a similar experience can mark February 11 for the early-access release of Starsand Island , another highly anticipated hybrid of Stardew Valley and Animal Crossing .
